recipe.title: How to Make Crinkle Cut Chips

procedure.summary: Preheat the oven and prepare a baking sheet.
procedure.description: Turn the oven on to 400 °F (204 °C). Get out a rimmed baking sheet and spread 2 tablespoons of the oil across the bottom of the sheet. The oil will prevent the chips from sticking and help them crisp up as they bake. Set the sheet aside. You can use canola, vegetable, or peanut oil.

Wash 3 large or 6 medium baking potatoes and use a vegetable peeler to remove the skins. Take a crinkle cut tool and cut the potatoes into 1/3-inch (8-mm) thick slices. Lay the slices flat and cut them into strips as wide as you'd like.

procedure.summary: Soak the chips in salty water for 10 minutes.
procedure.description: Get out a bowl large enough to hold the chips. Fill the bowl three-quarters of the way full with cold water. Stir in enough salt to make the water cloudy. Add the crinkle cut chips and submerge them in the salty water for 10 minutes. For example, if you used about 4 cups (0.9 liter) of water, you should add about 1/2 cup (150 g) of salt.

procedure.summary: Drain and dry the crinkle cut chips.
procedure.description: Lay paper towels across a large plate. Lift the chips out of the salty water and lay them on the paper towels. Blot the chips until they're dry.

Get out a large bowl and measure 1/2 cup (50 g) of grated Parmesan cheese into it. Stir in the rest of the seasonings until they're combined. You'll need:
1/2 teaspoon (1 g) paprika
1/4 teaspoon (1.5 g) seasoning salt
1/4 teaspoon (1.5 g) salt
1 teaspoon (0.5 g) fresh basil
1/2 teaspoon (1 g) garlic powder

procedure.summary: Spread the seasoning over the chips arrange them on the sheet.
procedure.description: Place the dried crinkle cut chips in the bowl with the seasoning mix and toss them until the potatoes are coated. Spread the chips evenly across the prepared baking sheet so they're in a single layer. Drizzle the last 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of oil over the potatoes.

procedure.summary: Bake the seasoned crinkle cut chips for 25 to 30 minutes.
procedure.description: Place the baking sheet in the oven and bake the potatoes until they become crisp and golden brown. This should take about 25 to 30 minutes. Serve the chips while they're still hot. Avoid storing the baked crinkle cut chips because they'll become soggy as they sit.
